intro: Larnax macasiana, commonly known as the yellow star moss, is a low-growing epiphytic plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lepidoziaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-like growth habit. The plant features bright yellow, star-shaped structures that are actually specialized reproductive organs called gametophores. Larnax macasiana thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found on tree trunks or rocks in rainforests. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
